Reviews.Title: “Always Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Virga017
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inns are always an excellent place to stay. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The lobby has a friendly feeling to it. If one is too tired to eat out, the food is good and the drink selection very good. And the staff are attentive and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet off the strip”
Reviews.Author: CyberTag01
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with my son's soccer team for a touranment. The hotel is a quiet, non-smoking hotel off of the strip. It is about 2.5 miles south of Mandalay Bay. They do have a shuttle, but it only runs once an hour, on the hour, so we didn't take it. There were several other sports teams staying here, which worried us but it was very quiet for a hotel full of teenagers. The hotel had a 'breakfast' room set up for the sports teams. The breakfast was good (scrambled eggs, toast, fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, several different types of cereals, oatmeal, juice, coffee and tea). The staff did an excellent job of keeping the items stocked and the conference room clean. Our room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. They are adjustable so you can choose how hard or soft you would like it. If you want to stay "off strip" and have a car, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: OregonSp8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on a business trip. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Onsite hotel is a great convenience. Did not use the shuttle, but I understand it runs once an hour to the Mandalay Bay. Would definatley recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled Flight”
Reviews.Author: jackandpatti
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled recently by United Airlines and they put us up for the night at this hotel. We were skeptical to stay someplace we didn't know anything about. The airline assured us that this hotel would be up to our standards but didn't know much else about it. We were pleasantly surprised when we got to this hotel. It was about two miles from Mandalay and they run a shuttle to and from there. The hotel was immaculate and the bed was awesome. It was very quiet compared to the strip but we really were happy to be in such a comfortable hotel. There is an outlet mall within safe walking distance. The only thing that was not good was the restaurant. Granted we were the only ones there because it was late, but I don't think it would have made a difference. We had airline credit to eat there but should have skipped it all together. There is a restaurant called Bootleggers within wlking distance and we should have gone there. The hotel staff was very accommodating by having our shuttle to the airport readynquite early. Over all, it was a very clean friendly and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: painted_daisies
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on reviews here and familiarity/liking for Hilton properties. I was travelling with my teen-aged daughter and we both value comfortable and familiar surroundings in a hotel. Our hotel stays are a large part of our 'experience' of a place and not just a place to sleep. This Hilton Garden Inn provided just what I'd hoped for in Vegas. We wanted a non-smoking, non-casino hotel that was off the main part of the Strip (but not too far) as this was our first trip and we didn't know what to expect in terms of noise, crowds and sensory overwhelm. We did not have a car during our 4 day stay and found that it is indeed possible to get around the Strip happily using the hotel shuttle, the trams from Mandalay Bay to Excalibur, and Monte Carlo to the Bellagio, the occasional taxi and, of course, walking. There are food options within easy walking distance from the hotel. The hotel also offers meals--as HHonors members, our breakfast was included, and one night we had dinner, reasonably priced and very good. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful; dining staff happy and solicitous, and the shuttle drivers were awesome. The shuttle is free and leaves for Mandalay Bay on the hour; pickup from MB is on the quarter hour (call to request); also will take you to Town Square Mall (different from the Outlet Mall just 2-3 blocks away) with the same pickup option. We were upgraded to a junior suite but found the larger air handler in the room disturbing to our sleep (not excessively loud exactly but something about the fan and the pitch was distressing to my ears) so we went to a regular room, facing the front of the property, which we loved. I used a google map to 'view' the area around the hotel before we left, and was a little distressed to see empty stretches across the street--looked like the middle of nowhere. However, once at the hotel, this was my favorite part--the view of sand, surrounding hills, and the big sky was beautiful! and an intriguing change from central NY. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! and highly recommend it for anyone looking for an inexpensive, quality stay off the main Strip in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: pleasetakemewithyou2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a group with three kids. We had a queen queen room and were happy with the room, and the hotel overall however there is room for improvement: The Good: *Free WiFi *Clean, well appointed guestrooms *Nicely maintained property *Super comfy beds! *free airport shuttle, and shuttle to mandalay bay *in room micro, fridge, and coffee (there are several grocery stores nearby too) *very close to inexpensive dining *non-casino hotel *nice fitness room! The Bad: *no free breakfast (ours was included in group rate) *maids didnt clean rooms until after 3-4:00pm! Makes it difficult to relax in the room *parking lot is close to main road (safety concern) *pool was closed for the winter (hot tub was still open)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and value close to, but not part of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Barb H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are "frequent fliers" when it comes to travel and hotels - of all the Hilton Garden Inn properties we have had the occasion to stay, this was exceptional in service, friendliness, cleanliness and location to the resort corridor, dining, shopping without the crowds. If you want to be close to the action but have a more controlled and comfortable stay, this should be at the top of your list to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the south end of strip”
Reviews.Author: linda d
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff including the drivers! Great choice of cable channels, microwave, refrigerator, real creamers in room. No powder!! Clean rooms and comfy beds, excellent breakfast with the best waitresses. Great location!! Next door to the outlet Mall with tons of great stores to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HappyNudistCouple
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - clean and comfortable rooms - the bed is adjustable to anyone's particular firmness - but we just could find our setting. Not very close by the actual strip - but overall very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place off the main part of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel10069
Reviews.Content: I've always stayed in the heart of the action in the middle of the strip before this visit. I had a trip planned on a busy weekend & there were no reasonable rates to be found on the main section of the strip, so I thought I'd try this instead. It was really close to the strip; you could see Mandalay Bay from our room. Booked in advance online & got a better rate, although non-refundable. Free parking. The check in was very quick, courteous, & efficient. Stayed 2 nights and had no complaints about the facility or our room. We didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel. It was quiet although it is close to the airport. They have a free shuttle to the airport & strip if you don't want to drive. I would certainly be willing to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: LEAVENONAJETPLANE65
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this location it was very nice and clean and the staff were all great ! The beds were great loved the shuttle service came in very handy.Laundry facility was nice to have on property didn't have to send out or look for a place to do laundry .The work out room was also great. The only draw back and of course this will not stop me from staying there again is that they don't offer a free breakfast you have to pay a fee of like 11 dollars ( I think) just for ceral and fruit and prepackaged sweet rolls of course you can also order a hot breakfast But I feel they should offer guest the choice of if they want to pay for a hot breakfast or eat things like ceral ,toast, fruit for no charge.But thats just my thoughts. What I like most is this place wasn't on the strip but in fact was closest enough if you wanted to go there so you don't have all the hoopla 24 / 7 I would recommend this place if you are traveling to Vegas to work the wifi was good the rooms were spacious so you can spread out easy access to the interstate system.Lots and lots of places close to eat at make sure you try Bootleggers great pizza....

Reviews.Title: “Scroll down for reservations on their website”
Reviews.Author: Don T
Reviews.Content: If you are making a reservation and using any of the options on rates, don't assume that the firts ones they give you the best rates, As an example, the current GSA (federal government rate) is $99/night, but the page that first displays is for "junior suites" with a gov rate of $149. You have to scroll down quite a bit to get to the actual gov rate. I believe that the old term for this in airline reservations used to be "block and tilt". It resulted in an uncovered $50 a night on an expense report.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! Excpected more though”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFrenzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super!nice, clean. however the service could have been a bit better at the front desk. they were quite slow. Still the fam and I had a comfortable sleep. Spent 2 nights here in a row, then returned for one more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: badstay1212
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was exelent, the rooms a super nice we had the suit and we just enjoyed the stay. You pay for the breakfast $13 per person, but the food was really good. Best $140 we spend for a Hotel ever

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RM30139
Reviews.Content: If you have business in the southern area of LV and want to avoid the casinos this is a great place to consider. Good location, quiet, breakfast and dinner plus an outlet mall and chain eateries within walking distance. Cheerful staff, very clean, comfortable (now with air adjust mattresses), afternoon cookies and first-class Precor equipment in the fitness room. I've beeb staying here since they opened (I think in 2004) and always look forward to a stay here. The rooms also have frig and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, smoke-free alternative”
Reviews.Author: MikeandGayle
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 disgusting nights at the Luxor (see my review for more info), we switched hotels to the Hilton Garden Inn based on the mostly positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We were glad we made the switch. The property is very clean, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, comfortable and since we spent a bit more for the suite, there was plenty of space for the 4 of us (2 adults, 2 kids). The only concern that I had was that breakfast at the on-site buffet was way too expensive for what it offered. However, the food was ok if you're in the mood to spend (or you won big at the casino?), and there are lots of other eating options nearby, so this isn't a deal breaker. While they're not on the main part of the strip, they are just a few minutes' drive away...well worth that minor inconvenience if you're travelling with a family and are looking forward to a bit of peace and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: mike585
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, on Las Vegas Blvd., Las Vegas, NV, during August, 2011. Upon checking into our room, we noticed there were no blankets. We had to contact the front desk on four different occasions during our stay. Each time we spoke to a different person. All individuals assured us that the blankets would be delivered to our room. However, it was not until the third day of our stay that the blankets were delivered to our room. Upon opening the plastic bags containing the blankets, we noticed one blanket was torn and both had holes. Additionally, during out stay, the internet service went down the morning of our second day at the hotel. I contacted the front desk and was told the internet service would be up within a short period of time. However, on the third day, the internet service was still not available and I could not get an answer as to when the hotel expected to have internet service. The internet service that would normally be available at the business center was also down. Due to poor service and lack of internet availability, we decided to leave after the third night. We had originally made reservations to stay at this hotel for seven nights. I cannot recommend this Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: rogerythat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the strip, however it is not located near any of the Vegas attractions. The rooms were nice, and service was good. This is a good place to stay for business due to the fact you do not have to put up with the usual Vegas crowd. Also, they have a free airport shuttle that is 24 hours. If ever on training here in Vegas again hopefully they choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Ohio_couple_movin_on
Reviews.Content: We came here because Irene changed our flight plans. Hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport. What a wonderful hotel, modern, up to date conveniences. Very quiet, restful night. Restaurant and bar in lobby. Best place I've stayed in. It truly rates 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: NoTether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this place. We travel from California to Utah 4 or 5 times a year. Rather than make the trip it one day we now make a habit of stopping off for a night or two at the HGI Strip South. It is a clean, quiet, well managed property with everything you need for a relaxing stay. We typically drag in about 4 Pm after a full day of driving and cool off in the pool,. I like the fact we don't have to leave the hotel for dinner. My husband gives the hotel extra points for the comfortable chair in the room and because the fitness center includes free weights. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Overall a well managed, well maintained property. Kudos Dave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent care from the staff”
Reviews.Author: 2011DesertRat
Reviews.Content: The staff makes the difference here. Remember the concept of "Customer Service"? Alexandra Daro has managed to build a team that truly delivers on this concept!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Yachats-Drew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way back home to Oregon from the Grand Canyon. My wife thought it would be fun to take the kids to Las Vegas. We did not have a room when we got to Vegas and looked originally at Circus Circus. Circus Circus was actually a zoo and not as clean as a zoo, so we searched elsewhere and came up with the Garden Inn which is just a mile or so from the strip. We thought it was strange that we could not check in until 8:00 at night (we got there about 5:00), but I understand that is normal for a Vegas hotel near the airport as folks will stay in their room until their flight time. So we found a reasonably priced dinner buffet about 2 miles south of the hotel, had dinner and then came back checked in and then explored the strip. No matter what anyone tells you, Vegas is not a place for families. Our naivety got the best of us. I had not been to Vegas in nearly 40 years. Skip Vegas if you are traveling with the family. There are some family related activities, but they are expensive and not as good as many of the zoos and aquariums in other parts of the USA. If you do need to stop here, the Garden Inn is a great, clean hotel that is far enough from the strip that you are buffered from the debauchery and vice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: kuuru
Reviews.Content: I travel often to Las Vegas for work related business. I usually stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo but after 2 concecutive bad visits I decided to try this HGI (as per a colleagues recommendation). What a great choice. Check in was a breeze and the night manager was friendly and welcoming. I noticed the bar/restaurant area had a decent crowd but wasn't too loud. The room itself was spottless with a comfy bed, great ammentities and I was even upgraded to a suite (living room area with another TV wasn't used but was nice anyway). Exercise facility was typical with a couple of treadmils, 2 elipticals, a bike and some weights. Very spacious and everything worked properly! Breakfast was the typical HGI but that is what I like. I travel often and I like continuity. I like to know that when I stay at a HGI I will expect the same or better anywhere I stay. One night I had room service and then next I ate at the bar. Both where very good. Bar staff was super friendly. There is a free shuttle to and from McCarren and also the Mandalay Bay. I believe they go elsewhere but I am not sure. Pool area was nice; however, I was unable to use it! Overall I enjoyed my stay. I am going to make this my go to place for future LV trips.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: WizardMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed the one night late June and found the HGI to be just perfect for our our needs. We needed to be near the airport for an early departure and after four days in amongst the noise and hubbub of a Las Vegas strip hotel,chose the HGI for our overnight stay, we were sorry we didn't stay the entire Las Vegas holiday. Yes it is a distance from the main strip area and a car is needed, however if you don't have a car, like ourselves, HGI do run regular shuttles to nearby destinations at regular intervals and also to the airport. Check in speedy and wecoming, check out efficient and accurate. The room was clean, had all we needed, large bed, soft mattresses and an abundance of pillows. Very quite and after the noise of the main strip area most welcoming. Walking distance to the South Strip outlet centre and the strip bus service. Would highly recommend and will stay here if we find ourselves in Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another great HGI - keep up the good work”
Reviews.Author: airpizz6
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many Hilton Garden Inns over the years - and they have always met our needs, this one especially so. Very easy to find - just a few miles from the LAS rental car facility. Check in was quick, including the water bottles and breakfast coupons - always nice after a lengthy cross-country flight. Room at the end of the hall on the top floor - a suite actually - one of the largest we had seen anywhere. The total floor space may have exceeded that of the 2BR timeshare we were moving to on the following day. Everything was new and functional to include both large flat panel TVs. The breakfast staff was very responsive - and the meal got the day off to a great start. Were driving to Henderson in the AM - and the location made this very easy. Only wish we could have stayed longer. Willbe back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a perfect experience-”
Reviews.Author: melbabes
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent and customer oriented. Maya is especially helpful at the front desk-always smiling and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: johndenio
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a haven for business travelers. The staff at this hotel make the stay wondeful. Thank you to Terra, Maya, Shannon, Krista, Dave.

Reviews.Title: “The greeting I recieved from Maya at the front desk made me feel at home!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed at. I travel every week and the staff here makes me feel like I am home. The service is excellent! Rooms and hotel are increadably clean! Maya and Pat are the best!! I love this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the First Floor”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: Ok, initially the problem was of our own making. We checked in early at 12 midday and front desk informed us that the only room available was on the first floor. We took it, big mistake. It was dull and worn, fuzzy TV and a large plant outside the window allowed only minimum light to enter the room. We asked for a room change and front desk told us they would let us know when another room became available. They didn't.. Back to front desk after 4pm and allocated a room on the third floor. Much brighter and fresher room although still rather dated although the flat screen TV was nice. Next problem was at breakfast where we were presented with a bill. Told server breakfast was included in room rate, so she then asked for a voucher. No voucher. Spoke to the very pleasant Alan at front desk who checked and said breakfast not included in your rate. Trotted off to third floor room to get reservation confirmation showing that breakfast was included. Back to Alan, voucher issued and back to restaurant. What a mess, poor service. This was our first experience of HGI and I fear this brand is not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Is Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4Life8899
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at the HGI is always amazing. Maya and the rest of the staff always make exceptions to get me checked in early and have always done a wonderful job of going way above their daily duties to make me feel at home away from home. This front desk staff makes this property my first choice every time when booking for business in Vegas. Cant thank them enough.

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: DebbieHeng
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I tend to stay at hilton affiliated hotels. This time I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn. It was great. It exceeded my expectations. The staff is awesome. They are friendly, helpful, and very accommodating to your needs. The rooms are clean, well maintained, and beautiful. The gym is newly remodeled with treadmills and individual TV's. The pool and hot tub is just right. Not too far from the strip, airport and outlet and town center mall. I thought it was the perfect location to hang out by the pool, experience the Vegas night life, shopping, and have great night sleep on there sleep number beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Off the Strip" Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Globebugs
Reviews.Content: This was our very first stay in a Hilton Garden Inn. It will not be our last if the standard is the same in all other Hilton Garden Inns. Parking was a bit tight here especially after dark, however we managed to find a spot to get the luggage in. Check in was excellent and all facilities and restaurant hours was explained without asking. There were cookies available to take to your room and a nice fire burning because it was a cold day. The room was a little smaller than we were used to in a chain hotel. However, it was neat as a pin and very clean. The furnishings were a little old fashioned but this may the style of a Garden Inn. Loved the fresh white towels and the lovely amenities in the bathroom. The bed was super comfy and although we had our own pillows there was a selection available. Free Internet in the room, always a plus for us. Coffee area, a fridge and quite a bit of hanging space for a smallish room. The room looked out onto the pool area which was way too cold to use anyway. We did not eat breakfast here as it was a little expensive for Las Vegas and there was a gas station next door or a few eateries towards the Strip. Also the outlets are a minute away by car for a bit of shopping. It was a Saturday night and a very cheap option compared to hotels on the Strip. Really liked it here and will be back if in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meeting in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WELDChair
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn Las Vegas was a great place for us to hold our week long business meeting in Las Vegas for our group of 40 people. The staff went way beyond the requirements in providing us excellent service, excellent food, and individual attention and really played an integral part of making our meeting a great success. The hotel even provided van service to an off site location for one day and delivered our lunches there. The catering staff was truly outstanding. No matter how well you plan, some unexpected things come up doing a full week group meeting. Cristina and her staff were wonderful in accommodating our needs. Personally, I liked having the meeting in a hotel that did not have a casino and the van service was available for folks to go to the strip in the evening after business was complete for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very noisy air conditioner”
Reviews.Author: makeup-face
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a suite in the back of the hotel. Had an awful night sleeping as the air conditioner from somewhere clunked on and off all night, even though I turned the AC off in the room. Not sure where this was coming from but it kept me up all night. I had to go buy a box fan to not hear this noise. This hotel would be great if it had a tiny kitchen in it as we stayed for 3 days and had to buy spoons for cereal in the morning as well as bowls. Other hotels I have stayed in that are suites, include a small kitchen with the amenities and for the price of this room, was disappointed in that. Also, the printer in the business center was out of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations-challenging location”
Reviews.Author: warrenglky
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The staff were wonderful, the food was very good and the price was very reasonable for Las Vegas. The location is somewhat of a challenge if you want to get somewhere quickly and don't have a car. Restaurants are within walking distance but it is not a short distance. Outlet mall is also close, but again, it is a bit of a walk. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from the airport AND to and from Mandalay Bay, which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, away from strip”
Reviews.Author: SavedByZero
Reviews.Content: On a quick business trip to Vegas, my colleague and I stayed at this property. It's conveniently located near the airport and close to some restaurants (we went to an IHOP for bfast the next morning and it was right down the street). It's far away from the big casinos and hotels, so you have to drive up the strip to get to them, but we were on a business trip to see clients in North Las Vegas the next day, so proximity to the hustle and bustle was not a priority for us. Great value for the money. Quiet, relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton Garden Inn Las Vegas - Strip South. Loads of free parking on-site, easy access to and from the hotel to wherever you're going. It's located right next to the Las Vegas Outlet Mall. The staff is friendly and love those chocolate chip cookies in the evening. The room was spacious, even for 4 people. We had 2 Queen beds and it was one of the best sleeps I've had in a hotel bed. There is a pillow top on the mattress and they are so good for my weary bones. There is a restaurant on-site if you don't want to go out of the hotel to find food. I like the business centre, internet was pretty quick. We used the laudry room. Need fresh clothes on our trip. The room comes with a microwave and a fridge. Quite convenient for those quick warmups like the cookies!! ;o) The bathroom is a little tight with not enough hooks or racks to put your clothes. But I have to say, they have managed to defog the mirror in the bathroom. After your hot shower, you can still see yourself in the mirror!! Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Bad views Bad views”
Reviews.Author: tomklike
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this to anybody! My room has two queens stuffed in a long narrow room. The patio is a large brick wall over the top is an ugly view of the empty lot next door! Horrible location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Off the Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: Want to be away from the strip but close enough to drive? Interested in the Outlet Mall or being close to the airport rental center? This is the place. It is new, spacious, extraordinary customer service. Who says there are no more Vegas deals for food, dinner that night was a 14oz strip steak for $12. There is an excellent Italian restaurant next door - Bootlegger Bistro. This is my favorite for business when in south part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary service and an endearing staff made all the difference on my wedding day!”
Reviews.Author: TeamJenkins_10
Reviews.Content: When my now husband, then fiancé proposed to me, I had no idea where our ceremony would be held, but due to divine intervention, we were lead to the fabulous Hilton Garden Inn South. From the very first conversation to the final kiss goodbye we were treated with the utmost esteem, respect and care. We understood the notion of bringing out family and friends would be good for the hotel business wise, which in turn would supply a level of comfort, service and amusement for us, but the treatment we received went far beyond our imagination. For instance, upon our arrival at the airport, the shuttle expediently picked us up, and took us to the hotel, and to our surprise we were 3 hours ahead of check in time, the staff accommodated us by sending our bags up to our room anyway. Suggested a wonderful Italian restaurant next door and promised our room would be ready after our meal, and boy was it! The suite was incredible; clean and inviting...from our balcony we could see the strip! The cafe service and food was great! The shuttle takes you to and from the strip. The staff was very accommodating in every way. If there was need of any kind, they went above the call of duty to fulfill it; and not in a jumping through hoops way, yet fond, engaging and in an enjoyable manner. They really give new meaning to "service with a smile". As stated this trip was a personal event, our wedding. Jennifer and Ms. Joni (of LV Wedding Connections) truly made our big day a divine and magical experience that we will never forget. Following the ceremony was our reception and it was a blast, due to the wonderful decor and service provided. I would recommend any and everyone to HGI South for their day! We considered the larger hotels on the Strip, which are nice, but the event would have been more like a corporate event--stuff and robotic, nothing compares to the level of love and respect we were shown at HGI. All of our guests fell in love with the staff, and couldn't say enough about them--thanks so much for making our wedding day a beautiful, divine and magical experience! Special thanks to Sales Manager, Jennifer, "Mama" Pat, Ms. Virginia, Louis, Mr. Bob, Mike, Dave, Katie, Ms. Antonia and the wonderful staff at the fabulous Hilton Garden Inn South! We now have an extended family and we look forward to the reunion!

Reviews.Title: “Not just your ordinary Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: BabsnMarty
Reviews.Content: Twenty-five friends from an online breast cancer support group had the honor of holding our annual face-to-face meeting at this Hilton Garden Inn. Jennifer and her staff turned themselves inside out and upside down to make us feel welcome -- and it was not just for us. Apparently, they do this for "just" anyone! In my opinion, the staff says it all about a facility, and this place just made the curve. Our banquets were works of art. We've all come to expect conference rubber chicken meals. Ours were exquisite, with special meals expertly and cheerfully made according to recipies sent in advance. Nothing was a problem. What I want to know is: What's wrong with this property? Thank you, Jennifer and your entire staff for making this meeting one of the best ever. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Strip Hotels”
Reviews.Author: maplebjb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Vegas simply for it's proximity to the outlet mall and the airport however I would consider staying here the whole length of my next Vegas trip. For many reasons over a strip hotel: No resort fee You are treated wonderfully I had my fruit salad (left from meal) put in a container with cutlery to take to my room (didn't need to ask) A bottle of water was offered to me my reception staff without asking for it My subsantial amount of luggage was bagged and left without any hassle or problem, with good humour in fact Free and great gym room Free shuttle to the strip and airport (saves on very EXPENSIVE cab fares) Very comfortable quiet room, very clean Free fridge and coffee machine (with coffee!) Inexpensive restaurants aplenty close by So all in all I would say this is a gem amidst a tourist ripoff strip. You are treated well and not like an assembly line of bodies.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - NICE INN”
Reviews.Author: TreesForever
Reviews.Content: Close to airport and rent-a-car center. Proximity to restaurants , shopping outlet, drug store, grocery store all within a two mile radius. Timely shuttle to the strip. Staff friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and room service terrific. Overall stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelvetiaCH
Reviews.Content: The only reason I picked the Inn was the location. We had an early flight out and wanted to keep the car rental for transportation. Easy trip up the Blvd and to the rental return. Our room was spotless. All the common areas were equally clean. The staff was helpful and courteous. The business center computer access was useful in getting our flight confirmations and boarding passes printed. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, very polite staff”
Reviews.Author: mrlittlejohn
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the HGI on the strip in Las Vegas was very pleasant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The accomidations was very nice and pleasant. I did observe the music being played at the pool was shutting of occassionally. I reported it to the manager and he immediately gave attention to it and had it fixed the very next day. Definately a nice place to stay. Fortunately I have free breakfast vouchers for my companies use of this location, but the cost for breakfast is too expensive. Yes, so many others hotels are also, but it should not be a standard!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly People, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: julieredhead
Reviews.Content: My stay here was prompted by my great experience with their location in Henderson. I was impressed by the nice staff and the clean room. The matress in my room was in desperate need of being replaced. The hotel evelators were dirty as well as the public restroom, so we cut our stay short and went back to the Henderson location for our 2nd night. What impresses me is that I received a nice email from the head of housekeeping addressing my concerns. The king matresses have been replaced and they are in the process of replacing the queen ones. The reason the restroom and elevators were ditry is that they had a large group of young adults who were there (for an anime party) and she says they were sorry for the condition of the public areas and plan to have more staff cleaning during future events. How great is that when you get an email from someone personally addressing your concerns! Very clean and quiet room. Great breakfast and staff too. Nice location right next to the outlet mall.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: dorir126
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel! Even though they were in the middle of remodeling, we were treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: jenmac7
Reviews.Content: The facility is beautiful! The staff is very professional and the proximity to all of the action in Vegas is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: pmccsan
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas monthly for business. I have stayed at this HGI many times. It is convenient for my work, easy to get to restaurants and shopping - a grocery store is not to far away. I have always had good service and a clean room. I enjoy the 'extras' that you do not get at any of the casinos. If you want something away from the strip - this is the place...about 3 miles south of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean!”
Reviews.Author: liveinasuitcase
Reviews.Content: I’m wondering why my towels are sheets are so dingy and grey, dirty looking even everyday… Turns out they were dirty. I’m sitting in the business center behind the front desk, and I overhear the front desk telling a man about the complaints over the linens. He says, well I know why - the water heater won’t heat up enough to get them clean. I asked latter who the man was and they said he was the general manager. I guess he would know. Apparently, this is an ongoing problem. So that person who snuck their dog in and wiped his paws off, or used that towel to shine their shoes-you’re rubbing your face with it. Those sheets, well you’re sleeping with the person(s) before you. Gross! The reason other reviews say the towels seemed like they had not been washed in days was because pretty much they had not! Additionally this hotel is only about 4 years old but looks like 20 in the rooms. The main areas look good though. The restaurant is only open for breakfast. The shuttle drops you at Mandalay Bay so you would have to take a $7 cab ride to even get to the MGM to take the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: beeswaxLondon
Reviews.Content: Everything we could have wanted from a hotel - CLEAN, spacious, opening windows (so many hotel windows in the US do not open, which is freaking weird), nice decor, comfortable beds, fridge, microwave, nice pool, free parking, very competent staff. Had had a bad experience the night before at a Hampton Inn with regards to cleanliness so was a bit dubious about this place, but had no need to worry - it was spotless. I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice All Around”
Reviews.Author: VirtualBizWeb
Reviews.Content: After a miserable experience on the main Strip, I found this place. With no reservations, I checked in for a very reasonable rate. Everything was above average, including the service and especially the room. They had a fairly nice pool and everything was super clean. Highly recommended if you are in Vegas with your own car and want to avoid the Hell of the main Strip. I would, and probably will, stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: MylaCanada
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very accommodating and at a good price. It was nice to be away from the strip. The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the strip. The staff at the front desk were awesome. The breakfast was very reasonable. Room was great. Do love the Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton Garden Inn On The South Strip”
Reviews.Author: Gone~Walkabout~Man
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, March 20th & 21st, 2009. Room # 322. The room rate was $ 90 USD for each night. That is a great price for a hotel room on a weekend in L.V. The room was big and the King size bed was comfortable. The Air Conditioner and T.V. worked. The front desk staff was cheerful, and helpful, and professional. Except when I checked out, they wouldn't provide me with a receipt. They said, I should have got one via the internet when I booked the room. I found this kind of strange, as I always get a receipt from Hilton, being a Silver Hilton Honors member. I didn't use their restaurant, as I was always out and on the go. This was a nice new Hilton, I give it a 3 1/2 stars rating. Neat, clean and very well kept. I will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value -- Got to Know Rules Before you Go”
Reviews.Author: treishag
Reviews.Content: The hotel website boasts a free shuttle. Luckily before my arrival, I contacted the hotel to verify hotel shuttle schedule. Airport pickup is done by calling hotel. Make sure you have hotel telephone number in your cell. Wait time can take over 45 minutes. The hotel airport shuttle leaves from the hotel at the top of the hour and goes to Four Seasons/Mandalay Bay special pick up area and the airport. They arrive at Four Season and Mandalay Bay 15 minutes past the hour. If you miss it, you need to wait another hour for the shuttle. Calling a taxi from the Mandalay Bay to the hotel costs $15. The shuttle operates from 7AM - 11PM to Mandalay Bay. The shuttle does not go next door to the Outlet, which as a solo traveler was baffling because it posed a security risk. The outlet was also in route to other stops, so I did not understand why it was not included. The shuttle is free, but you have to know the rules before using it. My room was nicely appointed. I had one king bed with a separate sitting area. The sitting area included a sofa, flat screen TV, and table. Also in the area was a desk and chair. The room also had a fridge and microwave. The bedroom also had a flat screen TV for a total of 2 flat screen TVs in the room. The restaurant/bar was great! Service was good even though it was close to closing time (10pm). I had a delicious chicken quesadilla. They had a business center with internet access with 2 computers. There were no time limits posted. This hotel would be recommended for those who do not want to be near the strip, but get a good valued room.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Garden Inn Good for business visit”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: This is a cookie cutter Garden Inn which are very comfortable. The location is pretty far south on the strip. It's beyond the "Welcome to Las Vegas Sign" which in my book means that it's not on the strip. Wherever Hilton GI gets their beds should be what is available in all hotels. The only gripe I have is that the workout room was downright nasty. There is not much for equipment and much of it had out of order signs on it. They really need to spend a few bucks and get some new stuff if they want business travelers back. In Vegas it's a luxury to be able to park less than 100 yards of your room so that's a big plus. Front desk staff were very pleasant, again a luxury in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “internet problems”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here. We had a nice room, and all but one of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We went to the restaurant one evening for appetizers - they were half price during happy hour, so we ended up making it our dinner. The hotel offers a shuttle to the Strip which is convenient since driving and parking aren't convenient on the Strip. The downsides - the wireless internet access didn't work properly. They were aware of this issue but didn't seem able to fix the problem. Then I tried to connect "wired", and that didn't work either. It took 2 guys a total of about an hour working on the situation to figure out the lamp (also the internet jack source in this case) was the problem. They brought another lamp and it worked fine. The morning we were leaving, we didn't receive a statement under our door for expedited check-out (as an HHonors member this is the norm, and in fact is the norm in most hotels I stay in these days). I called the front desk to ask wh (hoping they would bring one up), but instead I was told they don't do that because they can't slip them under their doors. It may sound petty, but I had three issues with that - first, some pizza delivery place had slipped an ad under my door the previous day (I informed the front desk clerk of this), second, she didn't offer to send one up, and third, their check-in brochure specifically states that they will deliver your statement the morning of check-out. At least change the brochure if you don't plan on following through.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: lotsanivanh
Reviews.Content: i would have loved to stay at the bellagio all week, but it was a business trip and their travel agent gave me few options and bellagio was not one of them... so i chose the hilton garden inn without knowing a whole lot about it. i stayed for most of the week and overall was satisfied with the accomodations. the staff was friendly, even when having to issue me new keys because i locked myself out... the self parking was convenient and plentiful, even on the weekend when the hotel seemed to be at maximum capacity. the fitness center wasn't impressive but had the basics and was nice and quiet, which i prefer during my workouts. the pool was on the smaller side but to scale with the hotel and very refreshing in the heat. the breakfast buffet was typical- nice and simple. i never got around to the waffles or omelets because i was always in a rush to head out, but it was an option. a big plus during my stay at the hilton garden inn was the complimentary high speed internet access; it's always a good thing. upon checkout i was told i had a tab from the bar- there is a "cozy" bar in the lobby which i actually never went to. apparently someone billed some drinks to my room, maybe one too many to drink (?). the front desk cleared up the issue with no fuss. all in all i enjoyed my stay here. it was a peaceful week off the strip and i was glad to have stayed here, not to say that i didn't have a blast staying at the bellagio before heading home, but it was nice stay all the same.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: MONTONYE
Reviews.Content: We use Las Vegas just for overnights, and have never been happy with where we've stayed: Either too sketchy, too drab, too smelly or too loud. Until we stumbled upon this Hilton Garden. It's perfect: Staff are nice, rooms are lovely, widows open for a bit of fresh air and there's no moldy/perfumey/sweaty odors. And it was a decent price, to boot. It's close to car returns and the airport and the gentleman who drove the shuttle was a gem. I'm rarely so happy with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CarlyMegsMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Memorial Day weekend, the start of a 12 day trip through Grand Canyon and Southern Utah. This Garden Inn was a great deal - only $119 a night for 2 queens. Great bedding, quiet, breakfast decent at $10 a person for the hot food buffet. Quite easy to get to from the new rental car location in Vegas - follow signs for the Strip, turn left instead of right, and it is about a mile down the road. Too cool when we were there to use the pool, but it looked nice (not real big, but well taken care of). Minor problem was one elevator of the 2 was not operating. Easy to drive down the Strip to Mandalay or Luxor and park in their garages to walk that end of the Strip. There is a shuttle offered from the hotel for free to Mandalay Bay for those without cars or who want to save gas. As others have mentioned, right next to the Outlet Mall and a variety of restaurants (there is also a restaurant in the hotel which did a surprisingly nice job on dinner our first night there).

Reviews.Title: “Quite option off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: LACat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while attending a concert across the street at the Hard Rock Casino. My only real complaint was the hallway had a not-so-nice smell. However, the room was clean and comfortable. The beds were great. Tiny bathroom but good shower with curved shower rod and good water pressure. Marble top sink is in the bedroom. Do not expect overboard amenities---there was shampoo & conditioner and soap, plus a hair dryer. Same rough white towels you find everywhere. There is a sitting area when you first enter the room, with a sofabed, small desk and wet bar. A very large flat screen TV separates the sitting area from the beds (we had a double-double). The TV pulls out and pivots slightly so you can watch it in bed. There is no restaurant or casino on site, but you can buy food in the lobby. They also serve a free continental breakfast. There is a great German beer hall restaurant right next door which was a lot of fun and had very authentic food. Also, the Hard Rock is catty-corner from the hotel. The free shuttle to the airport only runs once per hour, but you are literally two minutes from McCarren. If you are in Vegas to live it up, this may not be the place for you. It is more suited to the business traveler or someone on a short stay who doesn't want the madness of a big casino-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Annh
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn Las Vegas South far exceeded my expectations for this price point. What an excellent value! Hotels more than twice the price don't always achieve the level of satisfaction offered by this hotel. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to/from the airport and also to/from Mandalay Bay. Free internet. Walking distance to an outlet mall, and also to a drug store, fast food, etc. The hotel lobby has a living room type area with big comfy sofas in front of a large fireplace - looked so inviting - but unfortunately a big screen TV was blaring from over the fireplace - chasing me away. There is an in-house restaurant serving breakfast and dinner, and a tiny bar with a small TV blaring from the wall. There was an outdoor pool with a bit of nice landscaping, a laundry room, mini snack/beverage sale nook near the front desk and an exercise room. The hotel common areas were pleasant and clean. The room was clean, fresh and airy. The 1 bedroom, 1.5 bath suite was HUGE. The full bath was spacious and equipped with a separate shower, a whirlpool bathtub, hair dryer, Neutrogena toiletries (including shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, lotion, bar soap, q-tips). And best of all - wonderful, soft, stretchy bathrobes!! The half bath off the living room was roomy also. The living room was set up with work desk/chair, sofa, chair/ottoman, flat screen TV, mini-frig, microwave, tiny sink/counter area, coffee pot, complimentary tea/coffee, 2 phone lines, etc. There was iron & ironing board in the closet. The bedroom, again enormous for this price point, was set up with a comfortable king bed, nice linenes, flat screen TV, 2 chairs - one with ottoman, etc. The balcony contained 2 chairs and a side table. The bedroom and living room had separate temperature control, which was quite nice. The hotel was wonderfully peaceful - even though it was fully booked during my stay. The only complaint I would have is very minor - that the bathroom fan is linked to the light switch - so there is no draft free bathing allowed - unless you do it in the dark, of course! Yes, I would definitely stay at this Hilton Garden Inn again. What a fabulous bargain!

Reviews.Title: “HGI serves it's purpose...”
Reviews.Author: H00fhearted
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night in Vegas at the Hilton Garden Inn. This is a very convenient location away from the hustle/bustle of The Strip, yet close enough for a short ride to any casino. Sorry, no gambling here, but you get the solid Hilton product with the comfy bed, pantry breakfast and friendly staff! Best amenity of the hotel is the airport shuttle, just call when you get your luggage and they'll pick you up within 20-30 minutes (as promised by the front desk, but call to verify!), Do not hesitate to book this hotel...if, you want to be "off Strip".

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPB001
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our brief stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. Our room was good sized and clean. The beds were comfortable and the location suited our needs well. We were driving into Vegas to catch a flight out the next morning and the location was perfect. The Hotel is not located in the "heart" of the strip, but rather a few miles south of most of the action. It is right next to the Las Vegas outlet mall, which provides a nice diversion if you have a few hours to kill. It is also about a mile from the new Rental car return facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to avoid the casinos, but construction noise”
Reviews.Author: skiman273
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this property several times and it is nice, new and clean. Staff is helpfull and if you, like me, prefer to avoid the large casino hotels this property is great. No casino / no slot but close to everything. Rooms are clean and in my several vists I have never had any problems with my room. Only complaint I have is that they are adding a large addition to the hotel and during my last several visits construction has been ongoing. Not an issue during the night, but can be noisy during the day. Pool is small, but it is a Hilton Garden Inn so that is pretty much all you can expect. I expect to return to the Hilton Garden Inn and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dpoog
Reviews.Content: I must agree with the majority of reviews regarding the Hilton Garden Inn. It was the first time my wife, daughter, and I had stayed there. We were in town for a basketball tournament our daughter was participating in, and wanted a place away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We are Hilton Honors members so we booked through them. We've stayed at many Hilton brand hotels the last few years, but the Garden Inn provided us with one of the most pleasant stays I can remember. The Junior Suite was very spacious and comfortable. The furnishing were in great shape and the room was clean and tidy. It's located 2 1/2 miles south of Mandalay Bay, so the loacation was just what we were looking for (quiet). The pool area is cozy but nice. The lobby and the adjoining restaurant are roomy and well appointed. They even have a small cocktail bar which opens in the evenings. I especially want to compliment the staff who worked in the restaurant. They were so attentive and cheerful, they just made you feel good. All in all, we arrived at the hotel with no expectations, and departed feeling happy that we had stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet Base”
Reviews.Author: EwoodParker
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel at the end of a self drive tour prior to flying home to the UK. Thanks to Trip Advisor reviews the hotels we used during our trip had all been exceptionally good. However the Hilton Garden Inn without offering anything other than the expected facilities had the edge. This is a relatively new hotel with a good location away from the hustle of the main strip area and a couple of blocks south of the Las Vegas Outlet Mall. There is easy access for the airport and the car rental centre. The hotel runs a reliable hourly shuttle to and from the Mandalay Bay. Depending on traffic the ride takes about 10 minutes or less. The lobby area, reception and adjacent dining area are well designed being finished and furnished to a high standard. Our guestroom was both spacious and similarly well furnished with a nice bathroom. It also had the benefit of a unit with a refrigerator and microwave. Despite some construction work being ongoing at the time of our visit which appears to be adding more bedrooms to one wing and a pool bar/snack area our room and all pubic areas were kept spotlessly clean. A great breakfast is served well worth the $10 per head. In summary a good quality hotel with efficient friendly staff which provides a nice quiet base.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SacTown
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time finding a hotel to stay at for a conference I was attending. I finally booked the Hilton Garden not really knowing what type of hotel it was. I was pleasantly surprised, it's like a step down Embassy Suites. The hotel is located near the outlet mall on South Las Vegas blvd. If you are renting a car at the airport it is only minutes away. The hotel is somewhat new about three years old. I have to warn you that they are expanding the hotel and are doing a lot of construction work. I at no time encountered problems with the construction or any noise associated with the construction. The room I had was two rooms, a sitting room and bedroom each room has a tv set. There was a refigerator, microwave and coffee pot. There was also free wireless internet. There is a business center that I used to print up my Southwest Airlines ticket. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel so I'm not sure what is available. There is coffee located in the lobby. I had a car so I didn't use the free shuttle to Mandalay Bay. I did see the van on South Las Vegas Blvd near the Famous Vegas Sign and the guest were out of the van taking pictures of the sign. Remember you are not near the Casino's, there is a small casino near the hotel but I didn't go there. It took me about 20 minutes to drive to the Venetian. The are doing road work all along South Las Vegas blvd towards the Casinos. I have included some rather bad photo's of the room and exterior.
